Title: Social Media Influence as an Enabler of a Sustainable Knowledge Management System Inside PT. ABC Organization
Source title: Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)
Affiliations: Information System Department, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, West Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hutajulu, B., Information System Department, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, West Jakarta, Indonesia; Harisno, Information System Department, Bina Nusantara University Jakarta, West Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The goals of this research were to know the influences of social media as enabler for sustainable knowledge management inside organization of PT. ABC. Data were collected from 40 respondents and analyzed using multiple linear regression and Pearson correlation. It can conclude that the six variables—attention, personalization, context, integration, knowledge management lifecycle and outcome—on social media have influence to sustainable knowledge management inside the PT. ABC organization. © 2019, Springer Nature Switzerland AG.
Author Keywords: Knowledge management; Social media; Sustainable knowledge management
Index Keywords: Correlation methods; Database systems; Economic and social effects; Knowledge based systems; Life cycle; Linear regression; Social networking (online); Knowledge management system; Multiple linear regressions; Pearson correlation; Personalizations; Social media; Knowledge management
